column5: I‚Äôve got my therapist doing this in video sessions. My partner had caught their therapist doing it too as had one of my good friends. Seems like a crappy trend

Thank you so much for that reminder. I do hope to see some change seeing as this odd behavior didn‚Äôt happen until the last 10 minutes of our session. 
You sound like a super insightful and I truly appreciate it.
That really breaks my heart... this is the first therapist I‚Äôve really boned with. I wonder if it being therapy over video had anything to do with that.
And what makes you say that? Just wondering

I know - I didn‚Äôt want him to stop me but I wanted to hear some much needed encouragement. I don‚Äôt reach out often; I can count on one hand the times I‚Äôve reached out needed support. It‚Äôs usually just about scheduling and such.

I will bring up the style. It really sat with me wrong.

And I didn‚Äôt need 20 minutes. I needed like a couple minutes to catch my breathe.
Just bought a 15lbs heavy boi. I guess I‚Äôll see how it goes tonight

Honestly this sounds like the adult thing to do. I‚Äôll just simmer over it for the next two weeks I guess? I just felt like therapists are sort of supposed to be a blank canvas and not someone you walk away from a session with thinking about or harboring strong emotions in any towards.

We had been talking about this pattern of self-destruction for about 2/3 sessions. The comment on self-destruction wasn‚Äôt a threat but an honest fear that I have that I haven‚Äôt outgrown that pattern and the challenges waiting me would test that.
Thank you so much. I didn‚Äôt realize anyone else felt this way.. I can‚Äôt say thank you enough
....fuck. We‚Äôre way too young for that. But just reading some tiles... the shoe fits

I don‚Äôt remember the last time they went out of their way to make me feel sexy. Today they walked into the living room after a shower, dropped the towel and gave a dirty look... because I make them feel sexy. Because they like the way I look at them. I don‚Äôt remember the last time my partner made me feel sexy like that. They‚Äôve never made me feel sexy enough to drop my towel just to get a reaction. I think I deserve that too... I feel so undesirable

I watched it with my bipolar partner, and asked her how she felt about the portrayal afterwards. She said it felt honest, respectful, and important.

I felt like it really capture what it‚Äôs like being in a relationship with her; all or nothing. It felt like needing to protect her when she felt manic and wanting to love her back to life when she felt depressed. And honestly, it felt like being exhausted after playing both of those roles. 

The only thing I wished this episode/the one following it/any in the season showed is how much those of us with BPDSO so for the one we love.
That‚Äôs how it goes sometimes but you did it. No stopping you now!
Love seeing someone who runs at the same pace as me!! Honestly after W5D3, it gets so much easier. Idk why but after this 20 min run, I couldn‚Äôt run intervals anymore but 20 mins? 22? No problem!
Adjust it to your needs; just find a way to keep going.
Welcome to the community!! As someone who started this program as therapy homework to help with my depression and anxiety, I promise it has tremendous benefits. Keep at it!

The hardest part is getting started and you did it!! I struggled so much through day 1, and now I skipped all of W6 with intervals because I‚Äôd rather run 20 minutes non-stop! I woke up today WANTING to go on my run. Stick to it because it‚Äôs amazing how much you can change, grow, and get stronger with this program!
Girl I‚Äôm with you on finishing before it gets super hot! I just finished W5. It‚Äôs a tough one but you‚Äôve got this!!
Keep going! You‚Äôre killing it.
Amazing. Congrats!

Right!? If it‚Äôs my breathing, I need to slow down. If it‚Äôs my body, then I try to fix my form. If it‚Äôs mental, I tell myself to keep going for another minute before giving up. It‚Äôs wild how much of this is a mental endurance game.
Then why post here? Be miserable somewhere else and not in a sub where people are trying to support one another through therapy
It sounds like you‚Äôre not ready for therapy. If you go into it with that mindset, you‚Äôre going to be wasting your time and your therapist‚Äôs time.

It really is. Therapy is a journey to self discovery, and if you are honestly open to that journey, it leads you to a lot of internal growth.

It‚Äôs not just mental either. Part of my homework for therapy was to start exercising so that I could feel myself getting physically stronger as I get mentally stronger. Because of that, I‚Äôve picked up jogging and now I‚Äôm also becoming physically healthier as well as mentally. International self growth.

Sure! Constantly reminded yourself to slow down. 

I also did checks on my body whenever I wanted to stop ex: is it my breathing? My pace? My legs? My form? And then I‚Äôd try to fix it. If it was non of of those things, I reminded myself that it was mental and told myself I could stop if it didn‚Äôt get better in the next minute or so but it always get like I could keep pushing.

My biggest piece of advice is to avoid looking down at how much time is left.

Thank you! The run leading up to it (the failed W5D2) was tough, but I also realized it was a mental block. 

To prep for today, I mapped out a new route, freshened up my running playlist, and consistently reminded myself to slow down. I also did checks on my body whenever I wanted to stop ex: is it my breathing? My pace? My legs? My form? Or is it mental? That really helped. My biggest piece of advice is to avoid looking down at how much time is left.

My T is over 50. I do not what to expose them to anything so as much as I can‚Äôt wait to see them in person, I know it‚Äôs in their best interest to wait.

So unfortunately, I hope that it‚Äôs not soon.
Simply put: you are missing out on the opportunity for intentional personal growth.

I think the misconception is that it‚Äôs this huge moment. For me, I haven‚Äôt had a huge moment. I‚Äôve had small ones.

I have a moment I can pin-point that was a major break through for me but it sounds like nothing. In a tough session, we were working through some stuff and I said something that felt real me to me. My T carefully told me ‚Äúwhen you told me the story, you said you should be ashamed because of X but I heard was that X failed you.‚Äù It drastically, and in one fell swoop, challenged the way I saw myself. For me, that moment was a total mind-fuck. When I shared it with my partner, my partner didn‚Äôt understand why it was such a mind-fuck. It was so small but the impact was huge. 

So I don‚Äôt think it has to be this huge moment - I just think it has to be impactful to you.

1. Prologue: Restless leg syndrome

2. Everything‚Äôs alright

3. Explain (that look)
 
4. Why is that?

5. You already knew that

6. Honey (just breathe)

7. How does that feel?

9. Time‚Äôs up

I didn‚Äôt complete W5D3 but I ran longer than 20 minutes - even if there was a small walking break. The real accomplishment though was finding my stride and feeling like I could keep going. It was awesome. I‚Äôm failing but failing upwards and that feels good
You‚Äôre right! And we can only keep getting better if we stick to it!

Keep running. My therapist gave me homework to start working out and I chose running so I don‚Äôt have to pay for a gun membership and let me tell you. I honestly feel mentally stronger. Check out the app Couch to 5k. That‚Äôs a great starting point
Why would you attack me like this??
I already run so slow lol
Yeah it‚Äôs time to kick your therapist to the curb. Your therapist needs to feel like a safe haven and your current therapist is cheating you of that
Thank you!!!

Oh man. I‚Äôve got a few!

Physically - about two weeks ago, my partner and I went for a walk, and some of it was uphill. My partner, who is smaller than I am and from one quick look presumably in better shape, was having a hard time breathing and I was not struggling at all. It was the first time I felt any progress.

Mentally - I‚Äôve been hitting a wall on W5D2, and I knew it was mental. Today I manage to stay out of my head and even when I wanted to stop, I was able to keep going. I feel so much stronger mentally. I feel like I can do the tough stuff.
It‚Äôs amazing how mental this is. It makes me feel like I‚Äôm getting stronger physically AND mentally
I‚Äôm taking on W5D4 on Thursday. Here‚Äôs to hoping we both come back victorious
You look so happy and accomplished! I love it and I‚Äôm happy for you
Vamos ATL!
Slow down; that‚Äôll help a ton. And just take it one minute at a time. Your body is ready because you‚Äôve been conditioning so it‚Äôs just mind over matter now. You got this.
Getting started is easily one of the hardest things. The second hardest is convincing yourself to keep going but this community really helps with that. You got this!
You inspire me! I don‚Äôt know how I‚Äôll get to a 5k because of my pace but seeing you work on it and get close inspires me. Thank you!
Yep this makes a huge difference for me. Deep controlled breaths gets me through runs
Lady, you are a pillar of strength and inspiration!!

The first week is the toughest; you‚Äôre still getting used to running, you‚Äôve gotta accommodate for this new hobby, and you‚Äôve gotta learn that it‚Äôs mind over matter. Get through it and it get better.
I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs ever supposed to be easier - you‚Äôre just supposed to be more prepared
You can do this! You‚Äôve already started and that‚Äôs the toughest part
Congrats! That‚Äôs gotta feel great
Thank you! I‚Äôm going to hang out in this sub. Feels like it‚Äôs lots of positivity and support

I really really needed those kind words! It‚Äôs been a rough couple of days, and deciding to get up today and finish day 2 was my biggest accomplishment... which felt so silly. But this made me feel better about being proud of accomplishing that. Thanks again!!
Thank you for the kind words and inspiration!! I‚Äôm glad running helped you out of your lowest place, and hearing about your journey makes me feel hopeful!

Is it helping? 

My therapist said the idea is that I can get stronger physically and associate that with getting strong mentally. Basically, my therapist wants me to know that I can get stronger mentally just like I can get physically.
What is this? A crossover episode?
If I was your therapist and got this from you, you‚Äôd see tears.
She‚Äôs mine

I‚Äôm not in crisis, just in emotional pain lol

The office staff does some of my T‚Äôs scheduling, but they also do a lot of their own. I have much better luck with scheduling when I reach out to my T directly. I‚Äôve needed to move things around and have had the office staff not be able to make it work, but my therapist can.

I may send another email tomorrow if I don‚Äôt hear back today. Thank you.

Don‚Äôt tell me to calm down. I‚Äôm so over this culture of making something out of nothing. It‚Äôs ridiculous.

Yeah, my therapist knows. I hugged her while crying pretty hard one time without moving my head and she made a joke about me leaving a trail of tears in an awkward place. Another time I didn‚Äôt move my head and she was literally petting the back of my head. She‚Äôs aware. 

Again, this culture of turning nothing into something is so ridiculous and unnecessary.

Jesus Christ, you def made that way more of a thing than it actually is. Burying my head versus not moving it or too very different things. You think every hug I give her is incredible tight and lasts forever? Americans sexualize everything. Your purist roots never cease to show. Did you know that breasts are a very comforting thing for human beings because we associate it them with our mothers feeding us, as well as our mothers holding us close?? Read a fucking a book.
Again, it depends on the relationship. I trust my therapist enough to know she‚Äôs not going to offer hugs patients who may confuse them with something else.
Oh yeah that‚Äôs  completely different story. I totally understand your discomfort.

It would be unethical if the hugs were inappropriate. They‚Äôre not. I‚Äôm a hugger, and my therapist has picked up on this. Her asking for a hug at the end of an specially tough session when she was tough on me was her reminding me that she has my best interest in mind. 

Ethics are not universal. Hugs are appropriate for our therapeutic relationship while they may not be for others.

It sounds like your therapist may not be a good fit for you tbh. I‚Äôve been through my fair share of therapist over the last two years and I felt very uncomfortable with the wrong ones. I didn‚Äôt have enough trust so it made it hard to work on the tough things.

Keep looking - I promise it‚Äôs worth it. With my current therapist, I can ask anything and have enough trust too share anything. Even down to super intimate things like maturation without feeling awkward. 

I‚Äôve been where you are, and I‚Äôve seen the other side and you deserve to be on the other side.

My therapist uses gmail. It‚Äôs not like we have sessions over email - it‚Äôs more for scheduling things. She once replied to an email with something encouraging and sweet because I needed it, but that‚Äôs as intimate as emails have been. If it‚Äôs just for scheduling purposes, I literally don‚Äôt care.
I agree. But the president is an enormous piece of shit so

I had a therapist once that did the opposite. I told her I had been thinking about medication, and she felt like I didn‚Äôt need it.

I found a psychiatrist on my own who diagnosed me with moderate to severe depression, and anxiety. He couldn‚Äôt believe that therapist discouraged me from getting diagnosed.

I‚Äôm short, my therapist is tall. I usually end up being right at boob level whenever I hug someone tall. I usually move my head sideways so I‚Äôm not motorboating her but there have been a few times when I haven‚Äôt moved my head to the side because I needed the extra comfort. It‚Äôs never been weird but both of us being ladies probably helps.
Being short I always put my arms around her waist and hers usually wrap around but just below my shoulders. 
Our hugs length is usually whatever is appropriate but they happen after every session. They may be a quick hug after a session that wasn‚Äôt too heavy, but they may be a longer, more comforting hug when I had a rough go at it.
Once we had a session where my therapist was incredibly tough on me. She even asked at one point if she was being too tough and I told her it felt like it and she responded with something along the lines of ‚Äúsorry but you need tough love right now‚Äù.  At the end of the session I had no intention of hugging her but when I was about to walk out, she stopped me and asked for a hug. 
I can‚Äôt remember the last time our session ended without a hug. They‚Äôre comforting, and I‚Äôm glad my therapist is warm and affectionate like me.
They start at entry level salary but can go on to earn way more without needing a ton of promotions
Nobody starts making bank. Maybe STEM professionals. You work your way to making more. Therapists have a much higher earning potential than most other professions that start with low pay.
I mean... in a private practice, a therapist is making a very nice living

Thank you.

The worst part is that we got into a groove late last year and started making progress. Like things were coming together, and for the first time ever, therapy was working for me.

But then the holidays,  my travel, and now whatever is going on with her being booked up... I feel like maybe it wasn‚Äôt progress; maybe it was a fluke
Good person doesn‚Äôt make for a good therapist. I had a therapist who was clearly a good person but she wasn‚Äôt a good therapist for me.

Thank you! I know it might sound silly, but for so long (a mixture of my own issues and bad therapists), I thought I was too broken, and doomed to live my life as this broken thing,,, for the first ting in my like, I don‚Äôt feel that way.
This is lovely üôÇ

Love this. Love to hear that you therapist coco cherish moments with patients. 

I always enjoy sharing laughs with my therapist

I‚Äôm SO happy you found your fit. I struggled too and just sort of felt like therapy wasn‚Äôt for me.

But when you find the right fit, everything changes. You‚Äôre on a path now friend! Commit to your mental health journey, do the work, and the change will come. I‚Äôm really happy for you.

Nah that‚Äôs not a benzo. It is anxiety medication though. I was prescribed these for my anxiety and these are not fun. They just make you lethargic. They also take weeks to build up in your system before they start to work. Hated these so much

I think about this often.  

I keep wondering if someone would notice. I‚Äôm glad you noticed your friend is gone. Reach out however you can... because every time I dream about being lost I just want to be found

Yeah, I get that for sure. It feels like a slippery slope - like I know myself, and I can see myself constantly checking their page. It doesn‚Äôt do me any good to do that, specially considering that I have attachment and abandonment issues. It‚Äôs just nice to know I‚Äôm not the only one who has had that urge.
I honestly only started thinking about looking her up on social media because she told me about she was talking about something related to her social media.
Yeah, the intrusive part is what holds me back so much. Like our relationship is based on trust so I don‚Äôt want to violate hers.

Very brave of you to eventually bring it up with him.  I do kind of have the same fear you have of liking my therapist too much which is one of the big things holding me back. I don‚Äôt need to grow incredibly attached to my therapist you know?

We actually talked about transference today (because I  brought it up and asked her to explain what it is) and she doesn‚Äôt think it‚Äôs an issue in our relationship.

Honestly, I just had a mind-fuck of a session and it just left me wondering more about this person who just cut me open to see where the cracks in the foundation start.

Thank up so much for this valuable insight. I think my therapist does a good job letting me in just enough, but it‚Äôs not balanced so it sometimes feel like I wish that I knew this person that knows me so intimately a little better.

I don‚Äôt want to know more than what‚Äôs my therapist is willing to share. I like our relationship. I guess it‚Äôs just a after such a heavy session, I wonder who it is that i left all those pieces of myself with.

This ‚òùüèº‚òùüèº‚òùüèº I spent like two years thinking I had BPD and therefor was statistically very unlikely to ever truly change. This was incredibly difficult for me. My therapist explained why I‚Äôm not BPD, and I‚Äôve been making changes in how I cope with things because, turns out, I don‚Äôt have a personality disorder. 

Dr. Google is not your friend. Go see a professional.

Maybe pick out a few viable candidates and use EPA (or the equivalent of what your Insurance offers) for free consultation appointments? I know my insurance covers 5 early through EPA. Call your HR department. Can‚Äôt hurt to ask

Finding the right therapist is a journey. I once had a therapist tell me to go home because I was ‚Äútoo anxious‚Äù for a session. Shitty.

But you know what? Continuing on my journey helped me find my current therapist, who is amazing. The shitty therapists were worth it to find the right one.

Friend, I am so sorry for your awful experiences. I truly relate. 

I went through 3 awful therapist. I was burned out on therapy, convinced it wouldn‚Äôt work, and done trying. I went into therapist #4 totally jaded, and truly only there to appease someone important to me. And also because I forgot to cancel my appointment and I didn‚Äôt want to get charged a no-show fee. Anyway, I went to what I assumed was the first and last session with therapist #4.

Therapist #4 has been a game changer. I haven‚Äôt processed all my trauma, and I have such a long way to go, but I see changes in my life and the way I cope/deal with situations because of therapist #4. Therapist #4 made the search worth it. 

Don‚Äôt give up, friend. There is someone out there who can help you, but you gotta go through your journey to find them.

Oh yeah. But it stopped being uncomfortable the more comfortable I became with my therapist. I feel like she has a good sense of sense of who I am, and sometimes the silence is because she knows I have more to say. Sometimes i don‚Äôt understand the silence but the silence is always spent with her looking at me at me, or trying to regain eye contact, but the attention is always on me so I feel okay with it. Idk. I‚Äôm not a huge fan of silence but sometimes when I share something particularly heavy, I do need a breather.
Beautifully said üëèüèºüëèüèº

It‚Äôs weird  because I really have a hard time with intimacy. So much so that my therapist has lightly poked fun at it.  But at the end of the day, there is intimacy between my therapist and I. We do have a relationship, and while I know I pay for that relationship, her actions shows me that she cares about me beyond her obligation as a therapist.. but we‚Äôre not friends and I know very little about her. 

So it‚Äôs one sided, but I know in one way or another, she genuinely cares about me. People play different roles in your life, and her role is help me process trauma and learn how to best navigate my the adversity that has been coming my way lately. 

It makes me sad that one day this person will no longer play this role in my life, but when that time comes, it means I‚Äôm mentally healthy enough to handle things on my own. And you know what? Unless she retires or moves, I can go back to her if things start to feel too heavy again.

They have their place in our lives. And just like so many other people, it‚Äôs not permanent, but maybe take solace in knowing that you‚Äôll get to decide when it‚Äôs time to walk away. We leave a lot of pieces of ourselves behind in other relationships - at least with this one, you know you left those pieces of yourself with a good person.

Thank you! I‚Äôm not against making eye contact but making eye contact when talking about something heavy is really tough for me. 

The eye contact does make me feel like I‚Äôm the only thing that matters to her in that moment, but sometimes that much attention can feel overwhelming. I don‚Äôt mind attention - I speak publicly for work all the time, but I‚Äôm in control of those situations, where as here I‚Äôm very vulnerable. It‚Äôs a weird place to be
